Pre-Game Insights: The Philadelphia Phillies meet the Toronto Blue Jays after Kyle Schwarber hit three home runs against the Blue Jays on Tuesday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Blue Jays have a 54-10 record in games when they scored at least five runs.
Philadelphia is 35-31 on the road and 82-56 overall.
Phillies pitchers have a collective 3.71 ERA, which ranks fourth in MLB play.
Others: Wednesday's game is the fourth time these teams meet this season.
Vladimir Guerrero Jr. leads the Blue Jays with a.328 batting average, and has 39 doubles, a triple, 28 home runs, 61 walks and 91 RBI.
Schwarber leads the Phillies with 31 home runs while slugging.474.
Bryce Harper is 14-for-39 with six doubles and three RBI over the last 10 games.
